Dimension.description: Dimensions are arbitrary name/value pairs that can be associated with a CloudWatch metric.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of the dimension.

type.description: The name of the dimension.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the dimension.

type.description: The value for the dimension.

Metric.description: The Metric property type represents a specific metric.

properties.name: Dimensions
properties.description: The dimensions for the metric.

type.description: The dimensions for the metric.

properties.name: MetricName
properties.description: The name of the metric.

type.description: The name of the metric.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.description: The namespace of the metric.

type.description: The namespace of the metric.

MetricDataQuery.description: This property type specifies the metric data to return, and whether this call is just retrieving a batch set of data for one metric, or is performing a math expression on metric data.

properties.name: AccountId
properties.description: The ID of the account where the metrics are located, if this is a cross-account alarm.

type.description: The ID of the account where the metrics are located, if this is a cross-account alarm.

properties.name: Expression
properties.description: The math expression to be performed on the returned data.

type.description: The math expression to be performed on the returned data.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response.

type.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response.

properties.name: Label
properties.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression.

type.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression.

properties.name: MetricStat
properties.description: The metric to be returned, along with statistics, period, and units.

type.description: The metric to be returned, along with statistics, period, and units.

properties.name: Period
properties.description: The period in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

type.description: The period in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

properties.name: ReturnData
properties.description: This option indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric.

type.description: This option indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric.

MetricStat.description: This structure defines the metric to be returned, along with the statistics, period, and units.

properties.name: Metric
properties.description: The metric to return, including the metric name, namespace, and dimensions.

type.description: The metric to return, including the metric name, namespace, and dimensions.

properties.name: Period
properties.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.

type.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.

properties.name: Stat
properties.description: The statistic to return.

type.description: The statistic to return.

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: The unit to use for the returned data points.

type.description: The unit to use for the returned data points.

properties.name: ActionsEnabled
properties.description: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state. The default is TRUE.

type.description: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state. The default is TRUE.

properties.name: AlarmActions
properties.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state.

type.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state.

properties.name: AlarmDescription
properties.description: The description of the alarm.

type.description: The description of the alarm.

properties.name: AlarmName
properties.description: The name of the alarm.

type.description: The name of the alarm.

properties.name: ComparisonOperator
properties.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold.

type.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold.

properties.name: DatapointsToAlarm
properties.description: The number of datapoints that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

type.description: The number of datapoints that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

properties.name: Dimensions
properties.description: The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm. For an alarm based on a math expression, you can't specify Dimensions. Instead, you use Metrics.

type.description: The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm. For an alarm based on a math expression, you can't specify Dimensions. Instead, you use Metrics.

properties.name: EvaluateLowSampleCountPercentile
properties.description: Used only for alarms based on percentiles.

type.description: Used only for alarms based on percentiles.

properties.name: EvaluationPeriods
properties.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

type.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

properties.name: ExtendedStatistic
properties.description: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100.

type.description: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100.

properties.name: InsufficientDataActions
properties.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state.

type.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state.

properties.name: MetricName
properties.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm.

type.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm.

properties.name: Metrics
properties.description: An array that enables you to create an alarm based on the result of a metric math expression.

type.description: An array that enables you to create an alarm based on the result of a metric math expression.

properties.name: Namespace
properties.description: The namespace of the metric associated with the alarm.

type.description: The namespace of the metric associated with the alarm.

properties.name: OKActions
properties.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the OK state from any other state.

type.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the OK state from any other state.

properties.name: Period
properties.description: The period in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

type.description: The period in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

properties.name: Statistic
properties.description: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile.

type.description: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile.

properties.name: Threshold
properties.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

type.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

properties.name: ThresholdMetricId
properties.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

type.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

properties.name: TreatMissingData
properties.description: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points. Valid values are breaching, notBreaching, ignore, and missing.

type.description: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points. Valid values are breaching, notBreaching, ignore, and missing.

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

type.description: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

properties.name: Arn
properties.description: Amazon Resource Name is a unique name for each resource.

type.description: Amazon Resource Name is a unique name for each resource.
